intro: Monechma spissum, commonly known as the dense mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its woolly, fuzzy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, often found in chaparral and sagebrush habitats. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Monechma spissum is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water.
